channel.title: Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance
channel.description: Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance follows comedy duo and married couple Rose and Rosie’s most intimate adventure yet: starting a family. By speaking to friends and peers who have conquered parenthood head-on, they hope to learn how to rear their roost righteously in an ever evolving social climate. New episodes every Monday. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original from BBC Studios.

item.title: S4 E10. The ups and downs of surrogacy - feat. Jake and Hannah Graf
item.description: The girls chat to Jake and Hannah Graf, a transgender couple on their parenting journey via surrogacy. How do you find someone to have your baby? How do you ask them to do it more than once? And what’s scarier, being in the army or becoming a parent? Jake and Hannah share the tricky conversations they had to have, plus their traumatic lockdown experience when they weren’t allowed access to their own newborn, due to Covid.Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producers are Rose Ellen Dix and Rosie Spaughton and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producer is Rachel Simpson. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S4 E9. Single Parenting - Feat Marissa Farina
item.description: The girls catch up with old pal Marissa Farina, a former lesbian YouTuber! Marissa got married and planned to have a baby with her partner. But after a traumatic birth and a sudden breakup, Marissa found herself living as a single parent in the middle of a pandemic. How does it work when you planned a life for three but it doesn’t go to plan? What’s it like being stuck inside a house with a baby when you aren’t allowed to go outside or to lean on a support system? And most importantly, what does it look like to move on and find love again as a solo parent? Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producers are Rose Ellen Dix and Rosie Spaughton and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producer is Rachel Simpson. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S4 E8. Men give birth too - Feat. Kayden Coleman
item.description: Giving birth comes with its baggage, like physical changes, the emotional toll, and societal pressures. But imagine what it’s like for someone who already had their own struggles simply for being themselves. This week the girls chat to Kayden Coleman, a Black, trans, gay dad who gave birth… twice! An eye opening episode, Kayden takes us through his experience of finding out he was pregnant at 5 months in, and making the decision to share his journey online.Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producers are Rose Ellen Dix and Rosie Spaughton and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producer is Rachel Simpson. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S4 E7. Do we forgive our parents?
item.description: The short answer is no. Or is it yes? This week the girls air ALL their dirty laundry, including the grievances they have with their childhood and upbringings and where it all went wrong. Should we cut our parents some slack for not having today’s knowledge and support systems or should they have known better? And is this still a parenting podcast or is it just therapy?Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producers are Rose Ellen Dix and Rosie Spaughton and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producer is Rachel Simpson. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S4 E6. ‘Woke’ Parenting - How woke is too woke? Ft Dr. Kristyn Sommer.
item.description: This week Rose and Rosie take a crash course on ‘woke’ parenting with an actual doctor - Dr Kristyn Sommer, who some of you may recognise from her viral, sometimes controversial TikTok videos. The parenting rules have changed but is the new standard impossible? Is it ok to call your child pretty? To tell them they are good or bad? And more importantly, do robots make better parents than us? The girls investigate…Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producers are Rose Ellen Dix and Rosie Spaughton and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producer is Rachel Simpson. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S4 E5. Sex, stomas and snotty bums feat Hannah Witton
item.description: Just when you thought they couldn’t overshare anymore, Rose and Rosie do it again! This week they are joined with sex educator and vulva measurer, Hannah Witton, where they discuss bottom mucus, wet and dry vaginas, and pregnancy with a stoma. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producers are Rose Ellen Dix and Rosie Spaughton and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producer is Rachel Simpson. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S4 E4. What does your birth month say about you?
item.description: Rose and Rosie look at the evidence based predictions of personality, career and even sexiness based on the month you are born. Listen to find out which month has the lowest IQ, who's most likely to become an athlete, politician, or even a serial killer. What do the girls' months say about them, and more importantly which one are you? Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producers are Rose Ellen Dix and Rosie Spaughton and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producer is Rachel Simpson. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S4 E3. Is vaginal massage the key to success? Ft. Naomi Gale
item.description: Rose and Rosie catch up with viral TikToker and vaginal masseuse Naomi Gale to find out all about hidden items in our bodies (the fascia - who knew?) and how to have a therapeutic, emotional release by going inside… Whether you have a vagina or not, the girls learn how you can heal your trauma, childhood wounds and let go of old emotions. But is vaginal and anal massage the key to sucess? Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producers are Rose Ellen Dix and Rosie Spaughton and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producer is Rachel Simpson. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S4 E2. Is there such a thing as too attached?
item.description: Rose and Rosie take a deep dive into their unconscious reasoning behind their attachment parenting style, and question is it healthy? Was it Rosie’s lack of a father figure that pushed her to want to never leave her baby? Or is the root of everything Kyle Richards of the Real Housewives? The first episode in their new house is one to look forward to, as Rosie has an epiphany and Rose gets schooled with stats.Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producers are Rose Ellen Dix and Rosie Spaughton and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producer is Rachel Simpson. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S4 E1. 'Parenting' vs Reality
item.description: Rose and Rosie catch you up with what's been happening during their break, including how the reality of parenting isn't all it's cracked up to be! Who knew? Plus: not eating nappies, giving up the sexy car, being a business bitch and what to do with a long baby. Rosie discusses finally getting treatment for her post-partum anxiety. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producers are Rose Ellen Dix and Rosie Spaughton and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers is Rachel Simpson. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: #RoseandRosiePG - Season 4 Coming Soon
item.description: The girls are back! Bringing along their favourite plus one, Rose and Rosie are their usual candid selves, as you join them on the whirlwind ride that is parenting for a bumper edition of 17 eps! Expect incredible guests this season as Rose and Rosie chat to LGBTQ+ parents about what family looks like to them. There might be blood, hopefully some money and definitely some sex (if they ever share a bed again).Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producers are Rose Ellen Dix and Rosie Spaughton and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers is Rachel Simpson. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S3 E15. Baby’s first Christmas!
item.description: It's the most wonderful time of the year and Rose and Rosie can't wait to share it with their son for the first time. Featuring discussions on their festive favourites, the last episode of the series is a celebration of everything they've achieved this year and are excited about in the next. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S3 E14. Nature vs Nurture
item.description: Rosie has stumbled upon some fascinating facts about queer parenthood and is simply bursting to share. How likely is it that Ziggy will also identify as part of the LGBTQ+ community and how does that correlate with his having two celesbians as parents? This is an episode for all the geeks in the gaydom! Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S3 E13. Is Parenthood Harder Than We Expected?
item.description: Rose and Rosie are five months into Mummyhood. Following on from their worries in the previous episode, we take a look back on how their view of parenting has evolved across the series. From postpartum pain to blissful beginnings to disrupted sleep, it's the perfect time to reflect on what can only be described as a whirlwind. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S3 E12. Big Changes In Our Life
item.description: Rose and Rosie have decided to make some big life changes. From moving house to sleeping arrangements to the future of their YouTube career - they’re having serious thoughts about the next steps in their journey as parents, and as people. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S3 E11. We All Need Role Models - Feat. Abbie and Julia Ensign
item.description: Rose and Rosie speak to friends and fellow vloggers Abbie and Julia Ensign and to quote Rosie, “It’s like looking in a mirror!” R&R are often told that they are role models for other queer parents, but do they yearn for their own? Is it trailblazing all it’s cracked up to be?Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S3 E10. Stop Telling Us What To Do!
item.description: Rose and Rosie know they’re so lucky to have such a kind and caring community of folk around them, whether that be internet frogs, or IRL ones. But are they at the end of their tether with unsolicited advice? In this episode, the Roses open up about what it’s been like for them to receive annoying and sometimes patronising ‘tips’ throughout one of the most vulnerable periods of their life so far...Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S3 E9. Fairy Frog Parents - Feat. Linda Blacker and Sammy Albon
item.description: Like many in the LGBTQ+ community, Rose and Rosie are strong believers in chosen family. But is choosing exactly WHO gets to be in your tribe harder than it looks? In this episode, your faves chat about and to their Fairy Frog Parents, Linda and Sammy, all about these choices, as well as what can be expected from such a coveted role.Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S3 E8. Let's talk about sex, baby!
item.description: It's no secret that Rose and Rosie aren't shy when it comes to talking about intimacy. But has having a baby changed that? Is it logistically more tricky? Or are there mental barriers? Maybe they've defied all odds and got straight back into it...Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator. Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: S3 E7. Spooky Halloween Special
item.description: It’s the spookiest special of the season! To celebrate Halloween, join Rose and Rosie as they tell ghost stories, tales of haunted children and regale each other with their childhood experiences of Halloween. Also - perhaps the most important question of the season… What will they dress Ziggy as?!Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator.  Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: S3 E6. Rose’s Next Steps
item.description: This week, Rose and Rosie dive into all of Rose's updates. It's not been an easy ride, but I'm perhaps having Ziggy has made Rose want to try getting pregnant again. They talk about sperm shortages, IVF myths and the compromises that come with all of the above. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rhyanna Coleman and James Cator. Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: S3 E5. Mum Guilt
item.description: Rose and Rosie have only been parents for what feels like five minutes, but is it possible that they already feel mum guilt? In this episode, they discuss the surprising stuff that makes them feel guilty, the biggest lie they’re willing to tell their child, and if it’s inevitable that they, like everyone else, will mess up somehow. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rhyanna Coleman and James Cator. Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: S3 E4. Revisiting our parenting assumptions
item.description: Rose and Rosie always have lots of opinions on lots of things and we love them for it. In this episode, the girls revisit some of those pre-parenthood thoughts! They discuss whether they've changed their minds now Ziggy is here or whether they are, and have always been 100% correct in their assumptions. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. item.title: S3 E3. Have we fallen into roles?
item.description: Rose and Rosie use their philosophical minds to discuss whether parenting roles are inherently gendered or if that's a massive historical hang up from yesteryear. They also touch on what makes a co-parenting relationship strong - be that difference, similarity or simply... sex. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. item.title: S3 E2. Post-birth Recovery
item.description: The girls spill the beans on recovery this week! From the moment Ziggy entered this world in a tsunami of his own poo, to the mental see-saw of emotional obligations. item.description: Rose and Rosie are back for series 3 of their podcast shenanigans. item.title: S2 E16. Special Episode: Our Birth Story
item.description: New Mummies Rose and Rosie recount the (extremely eventful) birth of baby Ziggy. item.title: S2 E15. THE FINAL COUNTDOWN
item.description: The last podcast episode before Rose and Rosie welcome their little one into the world. Eeeeek! ARE THEY REALLY READY?! They better be. It’s been a long time coming and the girls want to reflect on everything they’ve learned over the course of these two series. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. item.title: S2 E14. Letters to Baby
item.description: With Baby due very soon, Rose and Rosie thought now would be the perfect time to each write their baby a letter. They read them out and discuss in the hope that one day, their child will be able to listen back to this episode and find out about their Mums’ worries and wishes alike. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. item.title: S2 E13. Advice from YOU!
item.description: Rose and Rosie are super lucky to have met so many interesting people over the last two series. They’ve received all sorts of tips and tricks! But there’s always room for more. They’ve taken to #RoseandRosiePG to hear your thoughts on what they should anticipate. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. item.title: S2 E12. Meeting A Donor-Conceived Person! Feat. Oli Benjamin
item.description: Rose and Rosie have spent loads of time talking about their thoughts and feelings on becoming parents - and rightfully so! But how about their child’s perspective? They meet Oli of the BBC documentary ‘25 Siblings and Me’ who was born to two lesbian Mums via sperm donation 21 years ago. He tells all about what it was like meeting his donor and donor-conceived siblings. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rhyanna Coleman and James Cator. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG. item.title: S2 E11. Raising An Anti-Racist Child Feat. Dr Adanna Steinacker
item.description: This week, Rose and Rosie have the pleasure of chatting to blogger and anti-racism activist Dr. Adanna Steinacker about how to raise purposeful children. With two little ones of her own and another on the way, Dr Adanna has an important discussion with the girls on how they can educate, inform and empower their child from the moment they welcome it into the world. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rhyanna Coleman and James Cator. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S2 E10. Will we FIGHT?!
item.description: Rose and Rosie are best friends as well as wives. They never argue and somehow agree on almost everything. But what about when it comes to parenting choices? Could the addition of another human in the house shake-up the girls’ serene and harmonious relationship with the world and each other?! There’s only one way to find out...Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rhyanna Coleman and James Cator. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S2 E9. Can you learn to be maternal? Feat. Dani Dyer
item.description: Rose and Rosie are joined by Love Island winner and brand new Mum Dani Dyer. They discuss whether you can learn to be a good Mum ‘on the job’ or if it’s something you’re born with. They also chat baby name judgement, birth plans and how to maximise the last few months before being joined by a mini-me.Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rhyanna Coleman and James Cator. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG. item.title: S2 E8. Homemaking, Decorating, Nasal Aspirating!
item.description: Rose and Rosie are self-proclaimed home bodies. Having had so much time within their bubble of the last year has been a real light in the whole pandemic thing. But how are they planning on making adjustments to suit their baby? Do they actually NEED all of the products recommended to them, or are companies taking advantage of their pre-parent anxiety? Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rhyanna Coleman and James Cator. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S2 E7. Seriously Suspicious Sperm
item.description: Not even our sensational celesbians could have predicted the events of this last year. Rose and Rosie really thought they'd seen it all when they dipped their toes in (and then very quickly OUT) of the black-market sperm circles at the very start of their journey. But the lack of *ahem* resource available right now via legitimate avenues as a result of the pandemic means many more prospective parents have no other choice than to search social for semen. Things are getting very ugly and the pair are on the cusp of uncovering some serious corruption... Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rhyanna Coleman and James Cator. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S2 E6. CELESBIAN Feat. Suzi Ruffell
item.description: Rose and Rosie met comedian Suzi Ruffell a few years ago on a rooftop at a New York pride event. But now they share a new bond - both R&R and Suzi are pending parenthood in a pandemic. Suzi talks all about how the adoption process works in 2021 and explains how she intends to maintain a balance between being a celebrated celesbian (Rose and Rosie's words, not Suzi's...) and a zero-drama-first-time-Mama. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rhyanna Coleman and James Cator. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG. item.title: S2 E5. Lots to unpack... Feat. a REAL LIFE MIDWIFE
item.description: CONTENT WARNING: Sexual abuse, birth trauma and miscarriage. For survivors of sexual abuse in the UK who feel affected by the above issues, resources can be found here: www.thesurvivorstrust.org. In the USA, you can visit: www.joyfulheartfoundation.org. For more information on Tommy's, visit: https://www.tommys.org.Following Rosie's revelation a few episodes ago, the couple decided it might be time to talk to a professional about their worries. Enter Amina! An actual midwife and mental health advocate. She gives the girls the lowdown on everything from dealing with negative experiences, being prepared for anything and perhaps most importantly... pregnancy poo consistency. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rhyanna Coleman and James Cator. Join in the conversation by using #RoseandRosiePG.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S2 E4. Daddy's Little Princess?!
item.description: Rose and Rosie preach tolerance, kindness and acceptance all day every day. But we all need a day off on occasion! item.title: S2 E3. Pregnancy, Identity
item.description: CONTENT WARNING: Sexual Abuse and its psychological influence. For survivors in the UK who feel affected by the above issues, resources can be found here: www.thesurvivorstrust.org. In the USA, you can visit: www.joyfulheartfoundation.org. Rose and Rosie had planned to talk all about pregnant sexy times in this episode. But as always with these two, things escalated quickly and it ended up going a little deeper than that. Rosie has a revelation about past trauma and how it is affecting her mental health during pregnancy. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. item.title: S2 E1. Trimester Fiesta!

item.title: S1 E14. Santa, BABY!
item.description: Rose and Rosie unwrap a very special podmas present - did they get what they asked Santa for this year? Plus, the man in red himself pops in so they can help out some friendly (maybe even famous) faces. It’s the most wonderful time of the queer!Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S1 E13. Christmas Surprise!
item.description: Rose and Rosie love Christmas and couldn't wait to come back and pop into your stocking for a l’il festive treat... Coming Monday 21st December! Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S1 E12. To be continued…
item.description: Rose and Rosie have listened. To their friends, their peers, their audience. Do they know what they want to happen next? Has this informed their choices for the future? What are their plans? So many questions and they have the answers!Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S1 E11. Double the Daddy Feat. Rufus Wainwright
item.description: What will it be like for Rose and Rosie’s child to grow up without a father figure? The girls speak to super dad and critically acclaimed songwriter Rufus Wainwright about gay parenthood, dynasties and expectations vs reality… Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S1 E10. The Adoption Option! Feat. Isma Almas
item.description: Rose and Rosie find out more about adoption from someone who has experienced it first hand. Comedian Isma Almas had two biological children with her husband before their divorce. Following that, she came out as gay and adopted a son with her current partner. Isma and the girls chat about the whole experience. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S1 E9. The need to nurture
item.description: Rose and Rosie have had a tricky old time on this journey to parenthood. Nothing seems to be going their way and it's both mentally and physically exhausting. And in the midst of a global pandemic!The girls update us on where they're at right now and why it's getting a bit frustrating. They remain hopeful, but in the meantime, how are they coping with the longing to nurture? Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S1 E8. Are gender reveals outdated? Feat. Jamie and Shaaba
item.description: Rose and Rosie discuss how gender and gender roles are affecting their decisions around starting a family. They speak to fellow vlogging couple Shaaba and Jamie about their plans for parenthood as a heterosexual couple with one trans half! That’s right. Jamie is trans. But does that affect their prospective parenthood? They discuss if ‘gender reveal parties’ are a fair part of online culture. Plus, Rose opens up about how she felt restricted growing up with enforced conventional gender norms throughout her childhood and how she hopes this will be different for her children.Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S1 E7. Cottagecore or cottage bore? Feat. Athena Kugblenu
item.description: Rose and Rosie live in the arse-end of NOWHERE. What will it be like for their children to grow up in the English countryside with two lesbian Mums? Do they worry they’ll face bullying? Or will the other children find it very cool and exciting? How will they feel at the school gate and at parents evenings? They speak to metropolitan Mum and stand-up comedian Athena Kugblenu about raising her baby in the city, and if that also has its downsides.Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S1 E6. Lights, camera, contraction! Feat. Louise Pentland
item.description: Rose and Rosie understand that documenting this journey means their future child(ren) will be able to listen back and hear about how they were brought into the world. But how much documentation is too much? They speak to arguably the most famous UK ‘Mummy Vlogger’, Louise Pentland, who has been broadcasting her life for 10 years. Does Louise have any regrets about living her life with kids so publicly? And with a video all about her home-birth featuring clips from the event, Rose and Rosie have plenty of questions…Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S1 E5. Do straight people have it easier? Feat. Yasmin Johal
item.description: It’s very early days and ALREADY Rose and Rosie have endured many challenges in this process. It feels unfair! It all would have been so much easier if they had been in a straight relationship… or would it? They speak to YouTuber Yasmin Johal about her experience of getting pregnant with her boyfriend during her second year of university, not realising for five months and having to navigate that whilst studying. All because of one romantic night! Rose and Rosie discuss whether for them, sex and intimacy not playing a part in biological reproduction has helped their relationship in anyway. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S1 E4. Let’s get ethical, ethical!
item.description: Rose and Rosie cover the politics of making a baby with two women. Is it an ethical process now? And as we grow closer to a future where bone marrow science means no sperm at all is needed, Rose and Rosie discuss where their morals and spirituality come into the equation. Both of them found spirituality a great coping mechanism throughout their miscarriage. But did any part of the experience make them question their faith in ‘everything happening for a reason’?Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S1 E2. Miscarriage and loss
item.description: Rose talks openly about how she became pregnant using donor sperm, but subsequently experienced a miscarriage. The girls will discuss what they did to support one another throughout the process, advice for anyone going through anything similar, and going forward with positivity.For help and advice on this topic, visit the Tommy’s charity website: https://www.tommys.org. If you’ve been affected by this episode and want to talk to someone, you can visit https://www.crisistextline.org.Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S1 E2. A seminal episode feat. a real sperm donor!
item.description: How the HELL do Rose and Rosie decide who should father their baby when they fundamentally hate men?! Is it really as easy as browsing through a catalogue? Did they really download a dodgy free app and advertise themselves as princesses looking for their dream sperm, desperate for a baby? And they speak to a real-life sperm donor. Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S1 E1. Two girls, one egg
item.description: Comedy duo Rose and Rosie boast over a million YouTube subscribers and have written their own book. They’re also a married couple about to take the next step in their relationship: they want a baby. How did they decide to have kids, what expectations do they have and how do they plan to do it? Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance is a Spotify Original podcast from BBC Studios. The producer is Leila Navabi and executive producer is Julia McKenzie. For Spotify, the executive producers are Rachel Simpson and James Cator. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Welcome to Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance
item.description: Rose and Rosie: Parental Guidance follows comedy duo and married couple Rose and Rosie’s most intimate adventure yet: starting a family. By speaking to friends and peers who have conquered parenthood head-on, they hope to learn how to rear their roost righteously in an ever evolving social climate. New episodes every Monday. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
